intro: Fraxinus pennsylvanica var. cubensis, commonly known as the Cuban ash, is a variant of the green ash tree native to the Caribbean. It is a deciduous tree that typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters, featuring a broad, rounded crown. The leaves are opposite, simple, and ovate with a serrated margin, turning yellow in the fall. Its bark is smooth and grayish-brown, becoming fissured with age. The tree produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in clusters, followed by samaras that aid in seed dispersal.
